xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: EXQuery HTTP Request Module 1.0.
Gets the HTTP Method of the Request e.g. GET.
Gets the Scheme of the HTTP Request e.g. https.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string : The Scheme of the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the Hostname fragment of the Authority component of the URI of the HTTP Request.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string : The Hostname of the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the Port fragment of the Authority component of the URI of the HTTP Request. If the port is not explicitly specified in the URI, then the default port for the HTTP Scheme is returned (i.e. 21 for FTP, 80 for HTTP and 443 for HTTPS).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:integer : The Port of the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the Path component of the URI of the HTTP Request.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string : The Path of the URI of the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the Query Component of the HTTP Request URI, if there is no query component then an empty sequence is returned.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string? : The Query of the URI of the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the URI of the HTTP Request URI.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string? : The URI of the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the IP address of the server that received the HTTP Request
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string : The IP address of the server.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the fully qualified hostname of the client or the last proxy that sent the HTTP Request. If the name of the remote host cannot be established, this method behaves as request:remote-address(), and returns the IP address.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string : The Hostname of the client that issues the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the IP address of the client or the last proxy that sent the HTTP Request.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:integer : The IP address of the client.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the TCP port number of the client socket or the last proxy that sent the HTTP Request..
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:integer : The TCP port number of the client.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the names of parameters available in the HTTP Request.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string* : The names of available parameters from the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the values of the named parameter from the HTTP Request. If there is no such parameter in the HTTP Request, then an empty sequence is returned.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $parameter-name The name of the parameter to retrieve values of.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string* : The value(s) of the named parameter, or an empty sequence.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: req:parameter
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: req:parameter($parameter-name as xs:string, $default as xs:string*) as xs:string*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the values of the named parameter from the HTTP Request. If there is no such parameter in the HTTP Request, then the value specified in $default is returned instead.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $parameter-name The name of the parameter to retrieve values of.
$default* The default value(s) to use if the named parameter is not present in the request.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string* : The value(s) of the named parameter, or the default value(s).

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the names of HTTP Headers available in the HTTP Request.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string+ : The names of available HTTP Headers in the HTTP Request.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the value of the named HTTP Header in the HTTP Request. If there is no such header, then an empty sequence is returned.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $header-name The name of the HTTP Header to retrieve the value of.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string? : The value of the named HTTP Header, or an empty sequence.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: req:header
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: req:header($header-name as xs:string, $default as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the value of the named HTTP Header in the HTTP Request. If there is no such header in the HTTP Request, then the value specified in $default is returned instead.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $header-name The name of the HTTP Header to retrieve the value of.
$default The default value to use if the named HTTP Header is not present in the request.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string : The value of the named HTTP Header, or the default value.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the value of the named Cookie in the HTTP Request. If there is no such cookie, then an empty sequence is returned.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $cookie-name The name of the cookie to retrieve the value of.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string? : The value of the named cookie, or an empty sequence.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: req:cookie
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: req:cookie($cookie-name as xs:string, $default as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets he value of the named Cookie in the HTTP Request. If there is no such cookie in the HTTP Request, then the value specified in $default is returned instead.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $cookie-name The name of the cookie to retrieve the value of.
$default The default value to use if the named cookie is not present in the request.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string : The value of the named cookie, or the default value.
